idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: United States Rivers (Generalized) is a polyline theme representing the major rivers within the United States. Attribute information includes the name, system and length of the river. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Rivers (Generalized) provides a base map layer of major rivers of the United States.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:5,000,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)
citeinfo.title: United States Rivers (Generalized)

In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent major linear natural flowing water of United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: Rand McNally New International Atlas; The Times Atlas of the World; Digital Chart of the World

attr.attrdef: The name of the drainage system that the river is a part.
attr.attrdefs: Rand McNally New International Atlas; The Times Atlas of the World; Digital Chart of the World

attr.attrdef: The length of the river in miles.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted and generalized the features from ArcWorld 1:3M. Added Name and System attribute values from the Rand McNally New International Atlas, the Times Atlas of the World, and the Digital Chart of the World. Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83) by splitting the United States into-if present: Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands-and the 48 contiguous states (including District of Columbia); converting each to NAD83; then merging them together. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenueâ„¢ request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

citeinfo.title: The Times Atlas of the World

serinfo.sername: The Times Atlas of the World

citeinfo.origin: Defense Mapping Agency, presently known as National Imagery and Mapping Agency
citeinfo.title: Digital Chart of the World

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added MILES attribute and calculated its values.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Removed the shoreline (lake) features. The values for the MILES attribute are unchanged since they represent the overall lengths of the rivers.
procstep.srcused: ESRI ArcGIS Resource Centers ArcGIS Online services - USA Prime Imagery

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Edited the incorrect geometry of Yellowstone River. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the ArcWorld 1:3M database and then generalized (tolerance unknown). The positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
